parser

Class ChessParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • parser.ChessParser

  • public class ChessParser
extends java.lang.Object
    Regroups all the methods to parse notations.
    Author:
    Clement Gautrais, Paul Chaignon

      • convertLANToSAN

        public java.lang.String convertLANToSAN(java.lang.String lan)
                                 throws IncorrectFENException,
                                        IncorrectAlgebraicNotationException
        Convert a LAN to a SAN.
        Parameters:
        lan - The Long Algebraic Notation.
        Returns:
        The Short Algebraic Notation.
        Throws:
        IncorrectFENException - If the FEN is incorrect.
        IncorrectAlgebraicNotationException - If the long algebraic notation is incorrect.

      • convertSANToLAN

        public java.lang.String convertSANToLAN(java.lang.String san)
                                 throws IncorrectFENException,
                                        IncorrectAlgebraicNotationException
        Convert a SAN to a LAN.
        Parameters:
        san - The Short Algebraic Notation.
        Returns:
        The Long Algebraic Notation.
        Throws:
        IncorrectFENException - If the FEN is incorrect.
        IncorrectAlgebraicNotationException - If the short algebraic notation is incorrect.

      • checkEnPassant

        public void checkEnPassant()
                    throws IncorrectFENException
        Set enPassant parameter at - in fen if no pawn can play enPassant.
        Throws:
        IncorrectFENException - If the FEN is incorrect.

      • getFEN

        public java.lang.String getFEN(boolean reduced)
        Re-build the FEN from the board.
        Parameters:
        reduced - True if the FEN need to be reduced.
        Returns:
        The FEN.

      • getColor

        public static PlayerColor getColor(java.lang.String fen)
                            throws IncorrectFENException
        Get the color that play next from the FEN.
        Parameters:
        fen - The FEN.
        Returns:
        The color.
        Throws:
        IncorrectFENException - If the FEN is incorrect: incorrect number of white spaces or wrong color character.

      • result

        public int result(PlayerColor gameColor)
           throws IncorrectFENException
        Return the result of the game by looking at the FEN, knowing the computer color.
        Parameters:
        fen - The FEN.
        gameColor - The computer color.
        Returns:
        0 for a draw, 1 for a win or -1 for a lose.
        Throws:
        IncorrectFENException - If the FEN is incorrect.

      • isCorrectFEN

        public static boolean isCorrectFEN(java.lang.String fen)
        Check is the FEN is correct. The FEN must contain at least 3 white spaces and exactly 8 slashes for the board description.
        Parameters:
        fen - The FEN to check.
        Returns:
        True if the FEN is correct.

      • check

        public boolean check(boolean current)
              throws IncorrectFENException
        Sees if board is in check state for the current player.
        Parameters:
        current - True to check the next player.
        Returns:
        True if the board is in check state.
        Throws:
        IncorrectFENException - If the FEN is incorrect.
